snippet: Ang Lee’s latest movie is an adaptation of the fantastical novel “Life of Pi,” about an Indian teenager marooned on a boat with a tiger for 227 days.
abstract: Ang Lee’s latest movie, Life of Pi, is an adaptation of the fantastical novel by Yann Martel about an Indian teenager marooned on a boat with a Bengal tiger for 227 days; Lee defies the old showbiz adage to never work with children or animals, adding additional challenges like water, 3-D, religious themes and the expectations of millions of fans of the book.
lead_paragraph: Ang Lee’s latest movie is an adaptation of the fantastical novel “Life of Pi,” about an Indian teenager marooned on a boat with a tiger for 227 days.
